# Test with default configuration (affinity=true, iterations=1)
generate
pkg1 BenchmarkTest1
pkg2 BenchmarkTest2
----
Command Group 1:
	Package: pkg1
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest1
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg1/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest1$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"
Command Group 2:
	Package: pkg2
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest2
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg2/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest2$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"

# Test with multiple iterations (affinity=true, iterations=2)
generate iterations=2
pkg1 BenchmarkTest1
----
Command Group 1:
	Package: pkg1
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest1
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg1/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest1$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"
Command Group 2:
	Package: pkg1
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest1
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg1/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest1$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"

# Test with affinity disabled (affinity=false, iterations=1)
generate affinity=false
pkg1 BenchmarkTest1
pkg2 BenchmarkTest2
----
Command Group 1:
	Package: pkg1
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest1
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg1/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest1$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"
Command Group 2:
	Package: pkg2
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest2
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg2/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest2$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"

# Test with multiple binaries (affinity=true, iterations=1)
generate binaries=(baseline, experiment)
pkg1 BenchmarkTest1
----
Command Group 1:
	Package: pkg1
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest1
	Binary Key: baseline
	Args: sh -c "cd baseline/pkg1/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest1$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"
	Package: pkg1
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest1
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg1/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest1$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"

# Test with multiple binaries and affinity disabled (affinity=false, iterations=1)
generate binaries=(baseline, experiment) affinity=false
pkg1 BenchmarkTest1
----
Command Group 1:
	Package: pkg1
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest1
	Binary Key: baseline
	Args: sh -c "cd baseline/pkg1/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest1$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"
Command Group 2:
	Package: pkg1
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest1
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg1/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest1$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"

# Test with multiple iterations, multiple binaries, and multiple benchmarks (affinity=true)
generate iterations=2 binaries=(baseline, experiment)
pkg1 BenchmarkTest1
pkg2 BenchmarkTest2
----
Command Group 1:
	Package: pkg1
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest1
	Binary Key: baseline
	Args: sh -c "cd baseline/pkg1/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest1$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"
	Package: pkg1
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest1
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg1/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest1$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"
Command Group 2:
	Package: pkg2
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest2
	Binary Key: baseline
	Args: sh -c "cd baseline/pkg2/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest2$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"
	Package: pkg2
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest2
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg2/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest2$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"
Command Group 3:
	Package: pkg1
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest1
	Binary Key: baseline
	Args: sh -c "cd baseline/pkg1/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest1$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"
	Package: pkg1
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest1
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg1/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest1$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"
Command Group 4:
	Package: pkg2
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest2
	Binary Key: baseline
	Args: sh -c "cd baseline/pkg2/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest2$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"
	Package: pkg2
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest2
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg2/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest2$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"

# Test with benchmark config - matching benchmark gets benchtime
generate config=benchmark_config
pkg1 BenchmarkTest1
----
Command Group 1:
	Package: pkg1
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest1
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg1/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest1$ -test.run=^$ -test.v -test.benchtime=100x"

# Test with benchmark config - no matching benchmark, no benchtime
generate config=benchmark_config
pkg2 BenchmarkTest2
----
Command Group 1:
	Package: pkg2
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest2
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg2/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest2$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"

# Test with benchmark config - multiple benchmarks, mixed match
generate config=benchmark_config
pkg1 BenchmarkTest1
pkg2 BenchmarkTest2
----
Command Group 1:
	Package: pkg1
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest1
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg1/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest1$ -test.run=^$ -test.v -test.benchtime=100x"
Command Group 2:
	Package: pkg2
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest2
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg2/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest2$ -test.run=^$ -test.v"

# Test with benchmark config and multiple binaries
generate config=benchmark_config binaries=(baseline, experiment)
pkg1 BenchmarkTest1
----
Command Group 1:
	Package: pkg1
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest1
	Binary Key: baseline
	Args: sh -c "cd baseline/pkg1/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest1$ -test.run=^$ -test.v -test.benchtime=100x"
	Package: pkg1
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest1
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg1/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest1$ -test.run=^$ -test.v -test.benchtime=100x"

# Test with benchmark config - different matching benchmark
generate config=benchmark_config
pkg3 BenchmarkTest3
----
Command Group 1:
	Package: pkg3
	Benchmark: BenchmarkTest3
	Binary Key: experiment
	Args: sh -c "cd experiment/pkg3/bin && COCKROACH_RANDOM_SEED=1 && timeout -k 30s 10m ./run.sh  -test.benchmem -test.bench=^BenchmarkTest3$ -test.run=^$ -test.v -test.benchtime=500x"
